children.name: select
Example - subscribe to the "select" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "select" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when an item from the popup is selected by the user.> **Important:** The event is not fired when an item is selected programmatically.

children.name: open
Example - subscribe to the "open" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "open" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the popup of the widget is opened by the user.The event handler function context (available via the `this` keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: filtering
Example - prevent filtering event when filter value is empty
Example - subscribe to the "filtering" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "filtering" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the widget is about to filter the data source.The event handler function context (available via the `this` keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: dataBound
Example - subscribe to the "dataBound" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "dataBound" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the widget is bound to data from its data source.The event handler function context (available via the `this` keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: close
Example - subscribe to the "close" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "close" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the popup of the widget is closed.The event handler function context (available via the `this` keyword) will be set to the widget instance.

children.name: change
Example - subscribe to the "change" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "change" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the value of the widget is changed by the user.The event handler function context (available via the `this` keyword) will be set to the widget instance.> **Important:** The event is not fired when the value of the widget is changed from code.

children.name: value
Example - remove applied filter before set the value

parameters.name: value `Array|String`
parameters.description: The value to set. A *String* value or an *Array of strings* is accepted. To clear the value, pass an empty array.

children.description: Gets or sets the value of the MultiSelect.> **Important:** If there are no items, the value method will pre-fetch the data before continue with the value setting.> **Important:** The widget will **clear the applied filter** if a new value is set. Thus it ensures that the original/whole data set is available for selection.> **Important:** This method **does not trigger** [change](#events-change) event.This could affect [MVVM value binding](/framework/mvvm/bindings/value). The model bound to the widget will not be updated.You can overcome this behavior trigerring the `change` event manually using [trigger("change")](/api/javascript/observable#methods-trigger) method.    <select id="multiselect" multiple="multiple">        <option>Item1</option>        <option>Item2</option>    </select>    <script>    $("#multiselect").kendoMultiSelect();    var multiselect = $("#multiselect").data("kendoMultiSelect");    multiselect.value("Item1");    multiselect.trigger("change");    </script>

children.name: toggle
Example - set text of the widget

parameters.name: toggle `Boolean`
parameters.description: Defines the whether to open/close the drop-down list.

children.description: Opens or closes the widget popup.

children.name: setDataSource
children.description: Sets the dataSource of an existing MultiSelect and rebinds it.

children.name: search
children.description: Searches the data source for the provided value and displays any matches as suggestions.

children.name: refresh
children.description: Refresh the popup by rendering all items again.

children.name: readonly

parameters.name: readonly `Boolean`
parameters.description: If set to `true` the widget will not allow user input. If set to `false` the widget will allow user input.

children.description: Toggles the readonly state of the widget. When the widget is readonly it doesn't allow user input.> There is a difference between disabled and readonly mode. The value of a disabled widget is **not** posted as part of a `form` whereas the value of a readonly widget is posted.

children.name: open
children.description: Opens the popup.

children.name: items
children.description: Obtains an Array of the DOM elements, which correspond to the data items from the Kendo UI DataSource [view](/api/javascript/data/datasource#methods-view).

children.name: focus
children.description: Focuses the widget.

children.name: enable

parameters.name: enable `Boolean`
parameters.description: If set to `true` the widget will be enabled. If set to `false` the widget will be disabled.

children.description: Enables or disables the widget.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the **MultiSelect** for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks. Calls destroy method of any child Kendo widgets.> **Important:** This method does not remove the MultiSelect element from DOM.

children.name: dataItems
children.description: Returns list of raw data records corresponding to the selected items.

children.name: close
children.description: Closes the widget popup.

children.name: Example - get options of the widget
Example - add a data item to the data source
virtual.valueMapper
children.description: The `valueMapper` function is **mandatory** for the functionality of the virtualized widget.The widget calls the `valueMapper` function when the widget receives a value, that is not fetched from the remote server yet.The widget will pass the selected value(s) in the `valueMapper` function. In turn, the `valueMapper` implementation should return the **respective data item(s) index/indices**.    <select id="orders" style="width: 400px;"></select>    <script>        $(document).ready(function() {            $("#orders").kendoMultiSelect({                placeholder: "Select addresses...",                dataTextField: "ShipName",                dataValueField: "OrderID",                height: 520,                virtual: {                    itemHeight: 26,                    valueMapper: function(options) {                        $.ajax({                            url: "http://demos.telerik.com/kendo-ui/service/Orders/ValueMapper",                            type: "GET",                            data: convertValues(options.value),                            success: function (data) {                                options.success(data);                            }                        })                    }                },                dataSource: {                    type: "odata",                    transport: {                        read: "http://demos.telerik.com/kendo-ui/service/Northwind.svc/Orders"                    },                    schema: {                        model: {                            fields: {                                OrderID: { type: "number" },                                Freight: { type: "number" },                                ShipName: { type: "string" },                                OrderDate: { type: "date" },                                ShipCity: { type: "string" }                            }                        }                    },                    pageSize: 80,                    serverPaging: true,                    serverFiltering: true                }            });        });        function convertValues(value) {            var data = {};            value = $.isArray(value) ? value : [value];            for (var idx = 0; idx < value.length; idx++) {                data["values[" + idx + "]"] = value[idx];            }            return data;        }    </script>

children.name: virtual.itemHeight
children.description: Specifies the height of the virtual item. All items in the virtualized list **must** have the same height.If the developer does not specify one, the framework will automatically set `itemHeight` based on the current theme and font size.    <select id="orders" style="width: 400px;"></select>    <script>        $(document).ready(function() {            $("#orders").kendoMultiSelect({                placeholder: "Select addresses...",                dataTextField: "ShipName",                dataValueField: "OrderID",                height: 520,                virtual: {                    itemHeight: 26,                    valueMapper: function(options) {                        $.ajax({                            url: "http://demos.telerik.com/kendo-ui/service/Orders/ValueMapper",                            type: "GET",                            data: convertValues(options.value),                            success: function (data) {                                //the **data** is either index or array of indices.                                //Example:                                // 10258 -> 10 (index in the Orders collection)                                // [10258, 10261] -> [10, 14] (indices in the Orders collection)                                options.success(data);                            }                        })                    }                },                dataSource: {                    type: "odata",                    transport: {                        read: "http://demos.telerik.com/kendo-ui/service/Northwind.svc/Orders"                    },                    schema: {                        model: {                            fields: {                                OrderID: { type: "number" },                                Freight: { type: "number" },                                ShipName: { type: "string" },                                OrderDate: { type: "date" },                                ShipCity: { type: "string" }                            }                        }                    },                    pageSize: 80,                    serverPaging: true,                    serverFiltering: true                }            });        });        function convertValues(value) {            var data = {};            value = $.isArray(value) ? value : [value];            for (var idx = 0; idx < value.length; idx++) {                data["values[" + idx + "]"] = value[idx];            }            return data;        }    </script>

children.name: virtual
Example - MultiSelect widget with declarative virtualization config

children.description: Enables the virtualization feature of the widget.

children.name: valuePrimitive
Example - specify that the View-Model field should be updated with the selected item value

children.description: Specifies the [value binding](/framework/mvvm/bindings/value) behavior for the widget. If set to true, the View-Model field will be updated with the selected item value field. If set to false, the View-Model field will be updated with the selected item.

children.name: value
children.description: Define the value of the widget

children.name: tagMode
children.description: The mode used to render the selected tags. The available modes are:- `multiple` - renders a tag for every selected value- `single` - renders only one tag that shows the number of the selected values> Every tagMode has a specific `tagTemplate` value. If you would like to control the content of the rendered tags,set a custom a [tagTemplate](#configuration-tagTemplate) value.

children.name: tagTemplate
Example - specify a template displaying the number of the selected values
Example - specify template as a string
Example - specify template as a function

children.description: The [template](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) used to render the tags.

children.name: itemTemplate
Example - specify template as a string
Example - specify template as a function

children.description: The [template](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) used to render the items in the popup list.

children.name: headerTemplate
Example - specify headerTemplate as a string

children.description: Specifies a static HTML content, which will be rendered as a header of the popup element.> **Important** The header content **should be wrapped** with a HTML tag if it contains more than one element. This is applicable also when header content is just a string/text.> **Important** Widget does not pass a model data to the header template. Use this option only with static HTML.

children.name: popup.position
Example - append the popup to a specific element

children.description: Specifies which point of the popup element to attach to the anchor's origin point. The value isspace separated "y" plus "x" position.The available "y" positions are:- "bottom"- "center"- "top"The available "x" positions are:- "left"- "center"- "right"

children.name: popup.origin
Example - append the popup to a specific element

children.description: Specifies how to position the popup element based on achor point. The value isspace separated "y" plus "x" position.The available "y" positions are:- "bottom"- "center"- "top"The available "x" positions are:- "left"- "center"- "right"

children.name: popup.appendTo
Example - append the popup to a specific element

children.description: Defines a jQuery selector that will be used to find a container element, where the popup will be appended to.

children.name: popup
Example - append the popup to a specific element

children.description: The options that will be used for the popup initialization. For more details about the available optionsrefer to [Popup](/api/javascript/ui/popup) documentation.

children.name: placeholder
Example - specify placeholder as HTML attribute

children.description: The hint displayed by the widget when it is empty. Not set by default.

children.name: maxSelectedItems
children.description: Defines the limit of the selected items. If set to null widget will not limit number of the selected items.

children.name: minLength
children.description: The minimum number of characters the user must type before a search is performed. Set to a higher value if the search could match a lot of items.A zero value means that a request will be made as soon as the user focuses the widget.> Widget will initiate a request when input value is cleared. If you would like to prevent this behavior please check the [filtering](#events-filtering) event for more details.

children.name: ignoreCase
children.description: If set to `false` case-sensitive search will be performed to find suggestions. The widget performs case-insensitive searching by default.

children.name: highlightFirst
children.description: If set to `true` the first suggestion will be automatically highlighted.

children.name: height
children.description: The height of the suggestion popup in pixels. The default value is 200 pixels.

children.name: groupTemplate
children.description: The [template](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) used to render the groups. By default the widget displays only the value of the group.    <select id="customers" style="width: 400px;"></select>    <script>        $(document).ready(function() {            $("#customers").kendoMultiSelect({                placeholder: "Select customers...",                dataTextField: "ContactName",                dataValueField: "CustomerID",              	groupTemplate: "Group template: #: data #",                height: 400,                dataSource: {                    type: "odata",                    transport: {                        read: "http://demos.telerik.com/kendo-ui/service/Northwind.svc/Customers"                    },                    group: { field: "Country" }                }            });        });    </script>

children.name: fixedGroupTemplate
children.description: The [template](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) used to render the fixed header group. By default the widget displays only the value of the current group.    <select id="customers" style="width: 400px;"></select>    <script>        $(document).ready(function() {            $("#customers").kendoMultiSelect({                placeholder: "Select customers...",                dataTextField: "ContactName",                dataValueField: "CustomerID",              	fixedGroupTemplate: "Fixed header: #: data #",                height: 400,                dataSource: {                    type: "odata",                    transport: {                        read: "http://demos.telerik.com/kendo-ui/service/Northwind.svc/Customers"                    },                    group: { field: "Country" }                }            });        });    </script>

children.name: filter
children.description: The filtering method used to determine the suggestions for the current value. Filtration is turned of by default.The supported filter values are `startswith`, `endswith` and `contains`.

children.name: enable
children.description: If set to `false` the widget will be disabled and will not allow user input. The widget is enabled by default and allows user input.

children.name: delay
children.description: Specifies the delay in milliseconds after which the MultiSelect will start filtering dataSource.

children.name: dataValueField
children.description: The field of the data item that provides the value of the widget.> **Important** When `dataValueField` is defined, the`dataTextField` option also should be set.

children.name: dataTextField
children.description: The field of the data item that provides the text content of the list items. The widget will filter the data source based on this field.> **Important** When `dataTextField` is defined, the`dataValueField` option also should be set.

children.name: dataSource
Example - set dataSource as an existing kendo.data.DataSource instance
Example - set dataSource as a JavaScript array
Example - set dataSource as a JavaScript object

children.description: The data source of the widget which is used to display a list of values. Can be a JavaScript object which represents a valid data source configuration, a JavaScript array or an existing [kendo.data.DataSource](/api/javascript/data/datasource)instance.If the `dataSource` option is set to a JavaScript object or array the widget will initialize a new [kendo.data.DataSource](/api/javascript/data/datasource) instance using that value as data source configuration.If the `dataSource` option is an existing [kendo.data.DataSource](/api/javascript/data/datasource) instance the widget will use that instance and will **not** initialize a new one.

children.name: autoClose
children.description: Controls whether to close the widget suggestion list on item selection.

children.name: autoBind
children.description: Controls whether to bind the widget to the data source on initialization.

children.name: animation.open.duration
children.description: The duration of the open animation in milliseconds.

children.name: animation.open.effects
children.description: The effect(s) to use when playing the open animation. Multiple effects should be separated with a space.[Complete list of available animations](/api/javascript/effects/common)

children.name: animation.open
children.description: The animation played when the suggestion popup is opened.

children.name: animation.close.duration
children.description: The duration of the close animation in milliseconds.

children.name: animation.close.effects
children.description: The effect(s) to use when playing the close animation. Multiple effects should be separated with a space.[Complete list of available animations](/api/javascript/effects/common)

children.name: animation
Example - disable open and close animations

children.description: Configures the opening and closing animations of the suggestion popup. Setting the `animation` option to `false` will disable the opening and closing animations. As a result the suggestion popup will open and close instantly.
